  • Field Details

    • addTransactionBtn

      public javafx.scene.control.Button addTransactionBtn

  • Constructor Details

    • PopupWindow

      public PopupWindow()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the necessary components for the popup window. - Populates the category selection input with predefined types (e.g., Shopping, Rent, Transport, etc.). - Calls the method to hide UI elements related to repeatable dependencies.

    • CancelTransaction

      public void CancelTransaction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Closes the popup window associated with the ongoing transaction cancellation.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event object associated with the action of canceling the transaction

    • AddTransaction

      public void AddTransaction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Adds a transaction (income or expense) based on user input and closes the popup window. Handles validation for missing or invalid inputs and delegates transaction creation to the API.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event object associated with triggering the action
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output error occurs during the API call
      InterruptedException - if the thread executing the API request is interrupted

    • setExpenseCategories

      public void setExpenseCategories(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Sets predefined expense categories to the category input field and makes the repeatable checkbox visible and managed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event object associated with the action triggering this method

    • setIncomeCategories

      public void setIncomeCategories(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Sets predefined income categories to the category input field and hides UI elements associated with repeatable dependencies.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event object associated with triggering this method

    • hideRepeatableDependencies

      public void hideRepeatableDependencies()
      Hides UI components related to repeatable dependencies in the popup window. Sets these components to be invisible and unmanaged, ensuring that they do not occupy space in the layout. The affected components include the repeatable checkbox, metric input, title label, and date picker container.

    • showDatePickers

      public void showDatePickers()
      Displays the date picker container by making it visible and manageable in the user interface. This method ensures that the date pickers are part of the UI layout and can be interacted with by the user.
